page.title: 01ARLESEY
page.content: Arlesey is an excellent example of a street village, running north-south for over a mile along mainly one road. There are two distinct parts to the village - the northern, older part around the church which has been extended with some 1930's council housing and smaller modern developments whilst the southern part dates from mid-late Victorian times. The latter area grew up near the brickworks and large hospital Unusually both parts had their own railway stations and sidings ran into the brickworks and acros the main street and along the drive to the hospital. The stations and sidings have now closed. The village today serves as a dormitory area for Letchwork, Hitchin and Stevenge although the brickworks and a number of other miscellaneous industries
